title: Pride of Britain Awards: Sam Faiers wears black strapless gown
text:
She's a doting mother to two young children.

But Sam Faiers took a night away from parenting duties as she attended the 2019 Pride of Britain Awards with partner Paul Knightley at the Grosvenor House hotel on Monday evening.

The Mummy Diaries star, 28, pulled out all of the stops in a stunning strapless ensemble as she walked the star-studded red carpet.

Yummy mummy: Sam Faiers took a night away from parenting duties as she attended the 2019 Pride of Britain Awards with partner Paul Knightley at the Grosvenor House hotel in on Monday

Sam looked stunning in her black gown which featured a skin-baring panel down her midriff with silk bow detailing joining the two sides.

She teamed the elegant dress with a chic black velvet neck scarf, while the form-fitting style of the floor-length gown highlighted her sizzling frame to perfection as she posed for snaps.

The mother-of-two styled her glamorous look with a pair of towering black strappy heels, while carrying her essentials in a bejewelled clutch bag in hues of green and gold.

She swept her golden locks up into chic up do, while accentuating her natural beauty with an expertly applied coat of make-up including a shimmering smokey-eye and slick of nude lipstick.

Stunning: The Mummy Diaries star, 28, pulled out all of the stops in a stunning strapless ensemble as she walked the star-studded red carpet

Sam attended the event with her long-term boyfriend Paul, who looked dapper in a navy suit.

More than 100 of the UK's biggest stars will come together at the Daily Mirror Pride of Britain Awards to honour the nation's unsung heroes on the landmark 20th anniversary of the event.

The awards recognise and celebrate ordinary people up and down the country doing extraordinary things.

Hosted by Carol Vorderman, celebrities and public figures including Prince Charles, Robert Downey Jr, Sir Ben Kingsley, Dua Lipa, Ant & Dec, Chris Pratt, Michael Sheen, Adam Lambert, Christine Lampard, Sir Michael Caine, Jonathan Ross, Suranne Jones, and the judges and casts of Strictly Come Dancing and X Factor will be honouring this year's awe-inspiring winners.

Glamorous: Sam looked stunning in her black gown which featured a skin-baring panel down her midriff with silk bow detailing joining the two sides

Wow: She teamed the elegant dress with a black velvet neck scarf, while the form-fitting style of the floor-length gown highlighted her sizzling frame to perfection as she posed for snaps

Elegant: The mother-of-two styled her glamorous look with a pair of towering black strappy heels, while carrying her essentials in a bejewelled clutch bag in hues of green and gold

Carol Vorderman said: 'Pride of Britain is such a huge part of my life, it's hard to believe it's 20 years since we first started. In that time, it has found a place at the heart of British life, and the winners represent the very best of us. I never fail to be humbled by them, and this year's are no different.'

Sam's glam night out comes shortly after she and sister Billie declared during the final episode of The Mummy Diaries that they are considering having another child.

As the episode drew to a close, the siblings teased what could be in store for them when the show returns in 2020.

Reflecting on the ups and downs of 2019, the pair declared that, even though their partners Paul Knightley and Greg Shepherd aren't enthralled by the prospect, it could be time next year for 'baby number three'.

Both are parents to a son and daughter each: Billie shares Nelly, five, and Arthur, two, with Greg, while Sam has Paul, three, and Rosie, who turns two next month.
